texts.value: Catalyzes the condensation of 2 farnesyl pyrophosphate (FPP) moieties to form squalene. Proceeds in two distinct steps. In the first half-reaction, two molecules of FPP react to form the stable presqualene diphosphate intermediate (PSQPP), with concomitant release of a proton and a molecule of inorganic diphosphate. In the second half-reaction, PSQPP undergoes heterolysis, isomerization, and reduction with NADPH or NADH to form squalene. It is the first committed enzyme of the sterol biosynthesis pathway

reaction.name: 2 (2E,6E)-farnesyl diphosphate + H(+) + NADPH = 2 diphosphate + NADP(+) + squalene
2 (2E,6E)-farnesyl diphosphate + H(+) + NADH = 2 diphosphate + NAD(+) + squalene
H(+) + NADH + presqualene diphosphate = diphosphate + NAD(+) + squalene
H(+) + NADPH + presqualene diphosphate = diphosphate + NADP(+) + squalene

texts.value: Terpene metabolism; lanosterol biosynthesis; lanosterol from farnesyl diphosphate: step 1/3

disease.description: An autosomal recessive disorder characterized by profound developmental delay, brain abnormalities, 2/3 syndactyly of the toes, facial dysmorphisms, low total and LDL-cholesterol, and abnormal urine organic acids.

texts.value: The disease is caused by variants affecting the gene represented in this entry
Belongs to the phytoene/squalene synthase family

features.description: influences plasma cholesterol levels; associated with increased total cholesterol and non-high-density lipoprotein cholesterol; dbSNP:rs4731
